result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hyatt A Lazear appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Hyatt A Lazear.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Hyatt A Lazear in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests an additional Scheduling Conference date, to review material with client. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Hyatt A Lazear
Current: 6853 West Kathleen Court, Apt 3, Franklin, WI 53132 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2022)
Prior: 552 West Fransee Lane, Glendale, WI 53217

Defendant Hyatt A Lazear in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Katie Bakunowicz for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06/03/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AL, ALL, BL, SL.

Defendant Hyatt A Lazear in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 049679,

Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@1p
